inn1.comm: Wide down the off side. Zaheer obviously a bit rusty but he seems to love starting waywardly against Australia
slightly short and not that wide but Gilchrist latches on superbly. Short-arm jab that races past the cover fielder for four.
full and outside off. Close to a wide but Steve Bucknor doesn't give this one. Gilchrist lets that one go unharmed
that's a much better ball from Zaheer. Full and straight. Exactly the kinds Gilchrist struggles against early. He's a bit tentative and pushes it to mid-on
slightly short and on his hips this time. It comes on quickly and Gilchrist doesn't have the time to spank it out of the ground. Taps it tamely to the leg side and picks up a quick single
A bit wide of off again and Hayden, facing for the first time, can't get to this one. Steve Bucknor obviously has pins and needles in his arms and doesn't call this one too. Why strain?
Left alone by Hayden. Wide of the stumps again but much better this time. Six off the over. What a tortoise-like start. Oops, we're not playing Twenty20.
Starts with a good short of a length ball slightly wide of the stumps. Gilchrist lets it go to the keeper.

wallop. Now that ball, pitched on leg stump and swinging further down, deserved the kitchen and the sink. Gilchrist, as if flying a kite, casually whipped it down leg side for a crackling four. Help yourself stuff
good comeback. Full and straight, Gilchrist taps it down the ground and the ball crashes into the non-striker's end stumps. Sreesanth doesn't get a hand to it, else Hayden would have been in trouble.
Wayward. That was too much for Suresh Shastri and he calls wide rightly so.
short of a length, just on off, pushed confidently to cover

straight and full, angling down leg side, Gilchrist turns it away with minimum fuss and picks up an easy couple. That line isn't going to work. Neither is the one wide outside off. Full and straight please.
Down leg side, swinging away again and he's lucky to get away with this. Gilchrist goes for the swivel tap but doesn't get the placement right. Straight to fine-leg for a single

Unbelievable! That's the sort of catch that you'll walk miles and miles to cheer. Full and wide of off stump from Zaheer and Gilchrist stands and delivers an airy swish that's flying away to the square fence. But Yuvraj Singh, in an Olympic gymnastic motion, throws himself full length to his right (his wrong side) and lunges with both arms to latch on to a sensational catch at point. Now that's the catch of the series. So far, at least
short and well directed. Defended cautiously by the new man
full, going away from the right-hander, thick edge to point
down leg side, Zaheer not finding that consistency yet. Wide called by Bucknor this time. The ball swings after it passes the batsman, in what is generally come to be known as posthumous swing.
angling down leg side, Hodge off the mark with a tickle down to leg
that's a good ball from Zaheer. Exactly where he should be bowling. Slightly wide of off and Hayden lets it go.
145.5 but that was wide, wider and widest. Swinging even. Dhoni got there easily but Hodge needed two brooms to even touch it..
this time down leg side. Sreesanth catching the wide bug. The movie offer on his mind?

Gone! Now that's Sreesanth's speciality. Two wides and then a peach. Close to the umpire, full ball, seam upright, pitching outside off and swinging in. Deadly swing, past Hodge's bat and onto his pad. Big appeal and Suresh Shastri does a Rudi Koertzen (slowly lifting his finger). Now that's what's called a set-up: wide, wide and castled.
147 now. Pace like fire, maan. Outside off and swinging away. Clarke lets it go.
swinging away again. This is a lovely seam position from Sreesanth. Clarke doesn't take any risk. This is good pace too.
That's even better. Made him play this time and Clarke is beaten all ends up. The amazing part is that Sreesanth is yet to open his mouth. Now imagine the scenes then.
straighter this time. Surely an inswinger coming up soon. Clarke middles that one back down the ground. Again in the mid-140s.
This one comes in. Pitching outside off and seaming in alarmingly. Clarke left it but that was close.
forward defense to point. Hayden is defending. Some small mercies.
full and straight again, Hayden takes a big stride forward and pushes it to mid-on. The length needs to be right.
short of a length again. This is good bowling by Zaheer. Hayden playing according to the ball's merit. Let's it go

Another good one. Hayden has nothing to do with it. Shoulders arms. Zaheer in the mid-130s. A good ten paces less than Sreesanth. But his length is troubling the Australians. Length is mandatory, pace is optional.
tapped to mid-on for a quick single. Hayden's stride was even longer than normal.
down the leg side. Line goes awry and Clarke glaces it to the leg side for a quick single.
Full and straight, Clarke gets a thick inside edge to fine leg for a single
Widest, widester, widestest. Sreesanth appears to have lost that one in the wrist motion. That was headed towards first slip.
outside off this time. His length has been fine throughout. Hayden has nothing to do with this. Still no words exchanged. Is this the Sree we know? A tactic to unsettle Hayden, surely
left alone again. Hayden is either shouldering arms to wides or shouldering arms to good balls.
Another wide. Some serious set-up this. Slow ball attempt, it looks like. Goes awfully wrong.
straighter, on middle and leg, good seam. Had Hayden missed, that was an lbw chance. But he gets some bat to it and taps it to the leg side
full and outside off, Hayden edges past second slip for four. A fourth slip would have helped on that occassion. But that was a good ball that cost four. Sreesanth grimaces but words there are none
big appeal for lbw, Hayden falls away but umpire Suresh Shastri is having none of it. Good finish to the over.
full and straight, tapped down the ground. Good rhythm from Zaheer now. India have two more left-arm seamers to call on. Australia have their work cut out.
short of a length, on middle and off, defended to the off side. Such cautious strokeplay would have never been seen in the good ol' days of Twenty20. Oh for the good times.
Now that's more like it. Down leg and cutely turned away to the square leg fence for four. Minimum fuss, efficient four. That's a poor ball, though.
On the pads again, tapped to the leg side and hurried a quick single. Chance of an overthrow but not taken

That's a cudgel. Wide of the stumps, good length and Hayden stands back and does what he normally likes doing: ravenously munching the offering. Crunches it past point for a rocketing four. Too powerful. Too wide from the bowler.
Good start, short of a length and forces the batsman to defend
Too short, wide and too easy. Clarke finding his groove gradually. On the back foot and ripping it forcefully past cover for four. He made the shot that time.
Similar ball, just a bit straighter. Clarke tries something similar but can't find the gap this time. This pitch might suit the Australian batsmen with their back-foot punches
good length ball, outside off, left alone by Clarke. That new bat needs some time to warm-up, it seems
full and straight, drifting onto the pads. Luckily for RP, Clarke smacks it straight to mid-on. That ball had four written all over it. Actually it had Kookaburra written all over it.
short of a length and wide outside off stump and Hayden does his thing, shouldering arms as if to the manor born
straight and on the pads. Turned away to square leg. Easy single
Beaten. Teasing delivery, outside off, angling slightly away with the angle. Clarke flirts with it but he's a bad flirt. Lucky not to get an edge
on the pads and smacked away for four through midwicket. There was a sweet tone to that shot (though nobody heard it because of all the noise at the ground).
on the pads again and easily turned away for a couple. What is this generosity for? OK, India being good hosts.
short of a length, defended down the ground. Zaheer picked it up and lined-up a shot at the non-striker's end. We want wicket, we want wicket .. goes the cheers
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
The Hayden walk. That walk is back. He casually strolls down and pumells it past extra cover for four. It's a dangerous walk that. He normally bats that way when in full flow.
short and doesn't rise that much but Hayden has all the time in the world to pull it away for four. That screamed past short midwicket. Hayden's bat is talking the loudest.
Intimidating push again, straight back to RP but that was struck with force.
Unpredictable bounce from RP. That predictable unpredictability. Clarke is a bit surprised with that and pushes tentatively.
lands short of length, well outside the off stump and comes in slightly with the angle, Hayden shoulders arms
Ah! Here comes the wide delivery. From round the stumps he sprays it well down the leg side and Dhoni makes an acrobatic stop
better. Landed on a length, around the off stump and went through the zone and interestingly, it bounced once before it reached Dhoni. Hmm...
fuller, but it drifts to the pads, Hayden tries to flick it away, falls over a touch while leaning forward and misses. The ball bounds off the pad to the off side. There is a solitary wide third slip
again on that legs, flicked away this time but straight to long-leg. The angle from round the stumps took the ball behind the square-leg.
ooh ...    Length delivery in the zone outside off, Clarke pushes at it tentatively and the ball clips the outside edge and flies between slip and the 'keeper.
full, driven crisply to the left of cover where a smart diving stop is made
nice probing delivery, lands outside off stump on a length and curves away. Hayden is almost sucked into driving but pulls out at the last minute. Dhoni loves the ball.
shuffles across, gets almost outside the line of a delivery angling in towards middle stump and pushes it to Tendulkar at midwicket
Flies over cover point. It was  a length delivery outside the off stump and Hayden drives on the up and gets it over cover point

six over fine leg! Banged in short, at the body, Hayden is late in swivelling but still goes through with the pull shot and gets a top edge over the fine leg boundary. The first time I saw a six over fine leg was by Salil Ankola in his debut game in Pakistan. Off Imran iirc.
another short delivery, pulled limply to deep backward square leg
on a length, around middle and off, defended on the front foot
from round the stumps, well outside the off stump, doesn't interest Hayden.
fuller but like in the last over strays on to the pads, Hayden again falls over a touch as he shapes to flick and the ball strikes the pad
on a length, on the middle stump line, pushed back to Sreesanth who does what he does for a living: picks the ball, threatens to throw back and gives a good long stare.
Ah! the slower one. That was the last stare was all about. Full and outside off, Hayden lets it go past him. One bounce to Dhoni
drifts to the pads again, worked to Ganguly at deep square leg
102 kmph, a super slow delivery. It pitched short of length and took forever to reach Clarke who waited and waited before punching it straight to cover
Full and on the legs, flicked away for a single
full and outside off stump, Clarke presses the left foot across and shoulders arms
fullish, on the off stump line, driven, along the ground,  to cover where Dravid misfields but recovers well to prevent a single. It went straight to his hand, in and out.
full but drifting down the leg side. For the last few overs, whenever Sreesanth and RP Singh have hurled it fuller they have drifted to the legs.
full-pitched on the off and middle this time, pushed towards left of mid-off for a easy single. Meanwhile, Irfan Pathan is warming-up
Irfan gets more exercise  at long leg as Hayden short-arm pulls a delivery on the leg and middle to him
starts off with a length delivery in the zone outside off stump, left alone

Twenty20 act repeated. Sreesanth cleans up Hayden. Again. A very bad slog, though. It was a length delivery, coming in from just outside the off stump, Hayden swung across the line and the ball beat the ugly heave to crash into the stumps.
oh some swing there. Full and swinging away, luring Symonds into a near-fatal drive. Beaten comprehensively
full and outside off, driven uppishly past the diving Yuvraj at backward point
in the corridor outside off, Clarke is not interested and allows Dhoni to come into play.
fuller, around the off stump, driven straight to mid-off. Had he placed it right he would got a boundary. It was full and straight.
full and outside off stump, Clarke drives crisply to left of cover where Gambhir makes a diving stop.
swing and a miss. Length delivery outside off stump, Symonds tries to cut and the ball flashes over the blade
overpitched outside off stump, Symonds says thank you and despatches it to cover boundary.
corrects the length, hits the good length, around the off stump, steered to third man for a single
inswinging yorker, dug to left of midwicket
length delivery on the middle stump, bends in, dabbed to the on side

Done in by the slower one. Clever. It was a lovely loopy slower one, delivered from the back of the hand, full and on the middle and leg, Symonds is foxed, tries to turn it to the on side, misses and is struck in front. Franklyn Stephenson, the father of the slower one, would have been impressed. Sreesanth banged his hands on the pitch - like he did after removing Hayden in Twenty20, after taking out Symonds.
beamer and he apologises immediately.  It was waist-high and 144k, Haddin manages to defend it away
on a length, around the off stump, steered to backward point
on the off and middle, from a length, defended to the off side
full in length, on the middle and leg, moving towards middle, defended on the front foot
full and outside off stump, left alone
on a length, on the middle stump line, defended to the on side
lands on a length, on the middle line, Clarke gets behind the line to defend to the on side
short in length this time, on the middle and leg, worked to right of midwicket
short of length again, on the middle and this time Clarke gets on top of the bounce to wrist it to wide of deep midwicket
on the middle stump line, nudged to the on side
full and hint of swing away, Haddin leans forward to defend to the off side
its still swinging. Full and curves away, Haddin covers the swing and drives to mid-off
hits the deck short of length, around the off stump, Haddin goes back and across to push it to the off side.
Superbly adjusted by Haddin. It was a slower one, delivered like a leg break, full and outside off, Haddin waited on the ball before driving it through extra cover
outswinger on the off stump line, Haddin eases it to left of mid-off for a single

fullish, on the off stump line, driven back to Irfan who lunges to his left to make a half-stop. The ball seems to have chipped the inside-half of the bat. Haddin signals to the dressing room to bring then a new bat at the end of the over
full again, driven to mid-off
outside the off stump, guided to third man for a single
short of length,  outside the off stump and that never climbed. Clarke flashes and is beaten by the lack of bounce and it bounces twice before reaching Dhoni
fuller, outside the off stump, Clarke stretches across, dead-bats it to the off side and rushes across for a quick single
full and outside off stump, squared driven to wide third man
flighted delivery, on the off stump line, worked to the on side
again leans forward to turn a flighted delivery to the on side
flatter, outside the off stump, padded away to the off side

Loopy flighted delivery, Haddin is beaten in the flight as he gets forward and the ball misses the bat but hits the pad and runs away to the off side. Had it not made contact with the pad, it would have been an easy stumping chance. Haddin had lunged forward and was out of the crease
What a ripper. Flighted delivery that turns in sharply from outside off stump, Haddin is beaten by the loop again and the ball threads the bat and pad gap and even beats Dhoni
straight and good length, driven back to Pathan
slightly wide of the stumps this time, full too and Clarke pushes it past cover. Karthik dives but it's over the ball and not towards it. Tendulkar mops up at cover.

that was close. For both an lbw and a run-out. Full and swinging in. Clarke struck on the back foot and there's a huge appeal for lbw. Not given. Then the batsmen go for a single and Dhoni, picking up the ball, can't get the direct hit. The lbw was close, the run-out would have been gone. Clarke stays
pushed back down the ground
Driven to the left of Powar at mid-off, not too far away from him. They go for a quick single but Powar misses the direct hit. Ouch. There seems to be a chance every ball
tossed up on off, turning in. There's some spin there. Pushed back cautiously
slow again, flighted up but Clarke plays spin well. His Test debut was in this very ground remember (where he made a famous century) and he waltzed down and whistles a lofted four over long-off
down the track again, driven to midwicket for a single
scurried single to the leg side. Haddin does the sensible thing by giving Clarke the strike
shimmies down the track, takes it on the half volley, turns it to the leg side, and hurries through for a single.
slow again, tossed up again and Haddin, who's been taking singles shyly, smacks it way over the bowlers head for a maximum. Short arm jab but sweet timing.
Pathan from over the wicket, Clarke moves his front foot away and turns it to the leg side for a single
can't get it away through the off side. Good controlled line from Pathan
short of a length and straight. Pathan has bowled straight and kept batsmen quiet over the last few weeks. No run again.
Haddin being tied down here. Short of a length, on the pads but Haddin can't find the gap. He's played some fine strokes but is stalling in between

that's a cutie pie. Short of a length and Arjuna Ranatunga would have been happy. Glided down to third man for a four. Elegantly done. Haddin is playing a strange innings - fluent here, scratchy there.
down the ground and pushing to mid-on for a single
slow and turning towards leg, Haddin tucks it behind the short fine leg and scampers through for a couple
pushed to mid-on.
flighted teasingly, forces the batsman to wait for the ball and tap it back tamely.
late cut again, not that well timed but they manage a single
short of a length and straight, pushed to the off side
cut away to third man but RP Singh prowls well, cutting off a boundary. Keeps them down to two. Well directed throw but a but too slow. A better one could have had the batsmen in trouble.
confidently pushed to the cover fielder
another straight one. Pathan is in control here. Twenty20 discipline to the fore. No space to maneouvre and Haddin pushes straight to mid-on
on the pads and flicked away straifght to the fielder in the ring
a slowish ball, tapped away to the off side for a quick single.
tucked to short fine leg where Gambhir, one of the better fielders today, pulls off a fine save
pitching on middle and turning towards leg. Clarke misses but a wide isn't called.
down the ground for a pushed single
Clarke backs away with a fleet movement of his feet and cuts away towards covers. A single is taken easily
flicked away to the leg side for a quick single
angled away to third man for a single
short of a length and tapped away to the covers for a single. Pathan keeping it simple and tight. Dhoni likes it
tucked away to the leg side and think of two. But Karthik will have none of it. Swooping down and hurling back a throw at the bowler's end.
straight again, not much movement but this is good control from Pathan. Clarke can't do much apart from push it back to the bowler
starts with a deliciously slow one but Haddin can't get it away. Back to the bowler
flighted outside off again, cracked to extra cover but Sreesanth moves around to cut off the boundary
good ball this time, bit of spin and loop too. Clarke doesn't read it too well, richochets off the bat and pad close on the off side

drilled by Haddin. A little shimmy down the ground and a fierce bottom-handed technique takes the ball racing towards long-off for a four. Hadding keeps pulling out these powerful shots amid all the scratchy prodding. Surely there's a talent hidden in there. NSW faithful will no doubt agree
Thick edge to third man. Clarke was in no real trouble playing that shot with no slips in place
prodded to the off side. Haddin not in total control but beware of the sudden jolt
shovelled in an ungainly fashion to long-off. Pathan's straight line working for him here. He's not giving much away
A rare wide one from Pathan. Clarke goes for the slash but can't get to it

lucky one that. Chipped towards point but that's just short of Yuvraj. He tries his best to scoop it up but can't get to it. The misfield results in a single that takes Clarke to his fifty. A valuable innings this
good short one from Pathan, surprises Haddin that time. He pokes tentatively and his beaten. Cherubic smile from Pathan. This boy's really enjoying the limelight once again.
patted back to the bowler. Slightly faster this time
straight again and keeping the batsmen on a tight leash
down the ground but it's too straight for the batsman. Pushed back to the bowler
straight and accurate again, pushed back straight to the bowler. Fine over that time. Yuvraj cashing in on the drinks break and getting a quick over in after that
short of a lengtha and wide of off, angled away to backward point for a single
straight and short of a length. He's lost much of his swing but learnt how to keep it straight and restrictive on a regular basis. Pushed back to the bowler
tapped to the off side for a quick single. Tip and run from Haddin.
ball stopping on the batsman now. Clarke can't get the timing going as he tries to flick one away on the leg side. Straight to the fielder
Poor ball, good innovation. Clarke decides to walk down the track and Pathan helps him  along by drifting one down leg side. Helped along to the fine,leg fence for four. Too easy.
On the slower side, pushed to long-off for a single. Pathan can't get his hands to it on the follow-through.
straight and full, defended back to the bowler
That's another Haddin beauty. Down the ground to Yuvraj and tonked over mid-off for a crisp boundary. He suddenly pulls these shots out as if all is in control. Quite an enigma this Haddin
pushed back to the right of the bowler but Yuvraj rushes along and pulls off a fine diving save
clipped behind square for a quick couple. Haddin looks to accelerate now
full and slightly wide, pushed to the off side but straight to the fielder

wide again, this time even more and Clarke spanks one through the covers. It's a well-timed drill but Zaheer Khan comes around quickly and pulls off a fine save. The umpire doesn't refer it to the third umpire though it looks like a close shave.
off-cutter this time, rolls his fingers over the ball. Straight too and Clarke defends it cautiously
driven to mid-on and hurries through for a single
now that's a gimme. Ending a good over with a full ball on the pads. Haddin has found his feet now and whips it away effortlessly to the deep point fence for four
Good start, not much room and Clarke pushes it cautiously to the off side
straight and full, pushed to the leg side this time but still no run
straight and on the pads, but to the fielder
tucked away to the leg side. RP getting the ball to jag back into the right-handers. Not providing room outside off and it's been a fine over so far
A poor delivery to end a fine over. On the pads this time and Clarke helps it along with minimal effort. Races away for four. He's not going to miss out on these toffees.
hits the deck on a length, around the off stump, Haddin gets on top of the bounce and taps it to left of backward point
goes for a yorker, falls short of the blockhole and Clarke creams it straight down the ground
around the off stump, angling away, steered to third man for a single
kicks up from a length, around that off stump again, dabbed to backward point
That's fifty for Haddin. Full and slanting away, steered to third man. Clarke rushes over to congratulate.
fullish, on the off stump line, driven past the bowler
full in length, outside off stump, Clarke goes on the back foot to square drive past point
on a length, around the off stump, pushed back to the bowler
leans forward to tap it gently to the off side and away they go for a quick single
slower one outside off stump, Haddin misses and Dhoni gathers on the bounce. He seems to have hurt his knee, looks uncomfortable out there

Slog and a miss. Short in length, on the middle, it curves in over the middle and leg, Haddin had a wild heave and a miss. There was some noise there as the ball passed the bat but no appeal was made. That's that.
way down the leg side
full, straight, on the middle and off, defended back to the bowler
on a length, around the off and middle, straightens a touch, punched back to the bowler
slower one on the off stump line, patted gently to the extra cover region
Thwack. Length delivery outside the off stump, Haddin cleared the front foot and flat-batted it on the up past extra cover. 200 up for Australia.
from round the stumps, full and outside off, square driven to right of sweeper cover
low full toss, on the off and middle, driven to long-off for a single.
stays round the stumps for Clarke too and hurls in a delivery full, almost at the blockhole, on the off stump line, jabbed to cover
full and on the legs and that's a gift. Easily flicked past square leg
moves away to the leg-side and drills a full-pitched delivery on the stumps to deep cover.
the lemon cut. Goes round the stumps, fires in a low full toss, Haddin drives outside the line and gets a inside edge to fine leg boundary
from wide of the stumps,  full and on the middle and off, driven down the track
outside the off stump, swatted away to wide third man for two runs. Excellent running between the wickets.
dug in short, outside the off stump cut straight to point.
from round the stumps, floated in full outside off, driven to the off side
leans forward to tap it to cover point for a quick single
moves around the crease and Yuvraj fires it in on a length and Haddin adjusted to late-cut it past short third man
on the middle and leg, swept to deep backward square leg
takes the pace off that delivery, floats it full and on the off stump line, driven to long-off
comes down the track, Yuvraj fires it in and Haddin mistimes a drive to the off side
gift-wraps a full toss and Clarke pulls it over deep square leg boundary. The slog overs are on.
flighted delivery, on the off stump line, driven to long-on
leans forward, works to midwicket for a single
full, driven to long-on for yet another single
shuffles to the off stump, Powar sends a floater on the leg and middle line, worked past square leg
retains the strike with a drive to long-off
double-spin attack. On the middle stump line, nudged to the on side
takes a step forward and cuts a short of length delivery to deep cover
slower, outside the off stump, Clarke adjusts to tap it to cover point

Stumped! Haddin comes down the track, Yuvraj drags back the length and Haddin tries to adjust by swinging across the line but is beaten by the turn. Dhoni does the rest. That was a fine innings under pressure from Haddin.
turns outside off stump, cut to backward point
Clarke gets his ton in style. Another full-toss lollypop from Powar and he swung it over deep midwicket. He loves this ground. He scored a Test ton in his debut game here.
gets off the strike with a drive to long-on
dropped by Powar. Flighted delivery outside the off stump, Hopes tries to work it across the line and gets a leading edge over Powar who hops up in desperation but can't hold on
Took a step forward, took it full and swung it high over long-on. Three full-tosses from Powar, three sixes.
charges down the track and lofts a floater from Powar to right of long-off
on the middle and leg, driven back to the bowler
gets a single with a cut to cover point
fires it in quick, short in length, pulled away to left of Gambhir at deep midwicket
outside the off stump, cut to short third man where Sreesanth makes a mess of a regular stop and gives away two extra runs
slower in the air, turning past the off stump, steered to backward point
slower in the air, full and outside off stump, mistimes a drive to cover
full and outside off, yorker length, Clarke misses to connect with his drive
shuffles outside leg stump, Sreesanth keeps it full and straight on the off stump and Clarke inside-edges a swing across the line to midwicket
Cleanly struck. Full-pitched outside the off stump, Hopes drills it past short cover. Dhoni now realises his folly and pushes Dravid to the edge of the 30-yard circle
146.1 kmph, outswinging yorker, dug out to cover point
backs to the leg side and tries to drive inside-out but the bat rotates in the hands and he ends up mistiming a drive to the off side
slower one, on a length, on the off and middle, he waited on the ball before cutting  it through vacant slip region
shuffles right across to flick a full-toss on the off and middle to deep square leg
backs to the leg-side and chops a length delivery to deep cover point
cuts to the right of sweeper cover this time
moves outside leg stump, RP hits the short of length and beast the intended heave
yorker, stabbed to cover point for a single
low full-toss, on the off stump, driven to cover
another shuffle to outside leg stump and he can't reach the delivery zipping through the zone outside off stump
backs to the leg-side, works a yorker on the middle and off to the on side
Here we go. Full toss on the off stump and Clarke drills it to the right of long-off fielder. No chance there. Clarke is on the roll.
slower one, on the off stump line, again from back of the hand, Clarke picks it and taps it to backward point
another slower one, but drifting down the leg side, Hopes takes out the bottom-hand off the handle, tries to swing it to the leg side but gets a leading edge to third man
backs to the leg side, Sreesanth fires it full and between the leg stump and Clarke who squeezes it out to backward point
Above waist-high full toss, outside stump, swatted straight to sweeper cover. And hence it's not a legal catch. The crowd roar initially before going all quiet.
on the middle and leg, mistimes a swing over square leg
another full toss outside off stump, Hopes frees his arms, gets a outside edge to third man boundary
from round the stumps, yorker length on the middle and off, driven to long-on
another yorker length, on the leg stump line, misses a intended flick shot and it runs off the pad to the off side
shuffles right across and jabs a yorker on the off stump towards mid-on
length delivery, slanting away from Clarke who reaches out to flat-bat it to extra cover
moves outside leg stump and drives inside-out to left of long-off
fullish, around the off stump, driven uppishly to long-off
yorker on the middle, dug out to cover point for a single
low dipping full toss, on the middle, driven to long-on
yorker length, on the off and middle, driven on a bounce to RP who swivels around and threatens to throw at the non-striker's end.
From round the stumps, full and on the off stump, swung to left of long-on where Tendulkar gets across to make the stump
backs to the leg side, reaches out a fullish delivery on the off stump and slices it through point.
almost at the blockhole, on the off stump line, mistimes a drive to mid-off
full and straight, keeping it simple, driven to long-off
Caught by Sachin at long-on. Full and straight again, lofted straight to long-on. Tendulkar takes it and looks back - the ropes are still a meter away.
hurls a yorker, Clarke stabbed it down the track and Lee was off the blocks. Zaheer picked the ball calmly and took out the bails at the non-striker's end

inn2.comm: Outside off, good pace to start with, Gambhir lets it go
similar ball from Lee, Gambhir shoulders arms again
147.2 from Lee but strangely the ball bounces before it reaches the wicketkeeper. Bit of rain now. Amid all this Gambhir continues to shoulder arms.
short of a length, Gambhir can't handle this pace at the moment. He needs to get behind the line more.
Pace, bounce and good carry this time. Gambhir pokes and is beaten. Tricky times this.
short of a length and directed at his ribs. This is a world away from the Twenty20 final at the Wanderers. Gambhir knuckles down and plays it well, pushes it down the ground.
That's more strange bounce. 142 kph and the ball dies before reaching the wicketkeeper. Outside off and Tendulkar lets it go but some two-paced bounce at the Chinnaswamy
cracker of a delivery. Outside off, moving away a shade and beats Tendulkar's drive. Just goes past the outside edge. That could so easily have kissed the bat.
145 kph this time. Over the wicket and angling it away from the right hander. Not that much carry, though
outside leg this time, good bounce and Tendulkar lets it go unharmed. India off the mark with a wide

nailed 'em! Johnson gets Tendulkar with a peach of a swinger. Full ball on middle and swerves in delectably. Tendulkar pushes straight but is beaten comprehensively. Struck on the pads and that was going to strike leg. Suresh Shastri upholds the appeal. Big wicket for Australia. This was the man in fine form in England.
slashed away confidently past cover for a sizzling four, Gambhir won't miss out on the short and wide ones, not after his red-hot run in the Twenty20 competetion.
shouldered arms but oh, another four. The ball bounced in front of Gilchrist and richochet off his pads for a four to third man. Four byes there. It doesn't matter how they come ...
short of a length, outside off, left alone
